meanings.definition: In a deeply engaged or absorbed manner.
meanings.sent1: She listened raptly to the story, her eyes wide with wonder.
meanings.sent2: The audience watched raptly as the magician performed his tricks.
meanings.sent3: The cat stared raptly at the moving laser pointer, trying to catch it.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted raptly, lost in the colors and shapes before him.
meanings.sent5: The child gazed raptly at the stars, imagining faraway worlds.

meanings.sent1: The raptly curious student asked many questions during the science experiment.
meanings.sent2: Her raptly expression revealed her love for the subject.
meanings.sent3: The raptly puppy chased its tail in circles, captivated by the movement.
meanings.sent4: The raptly audience clapped enthusiastically at the end of the performance.
meanings.sent5: The raptly child stared at the colorful fish in the aquarium, mesmerized by their beauty.

meanings.sent1: He worked raptly on his project, ignoring all distractions around him.
meanings.sent2: The student listened raptly to the teacher's instructions before starting the test.
meanings.sent3: The cat followed the laser pointer raptly, not letting it out of sight.
meanings.sent4: The detective examined the evidence raptly, searching for any clues.
meanings.sent5: The musician played the piano raptly, pouring his emotions into the music.
